intro: Jacquinia berteroi var. angustior, commonly known as narrowleaf jacquinia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and it produces white or pale pink blooms in late spring to early summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to harsh conditions.
